title: General
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

  1. 1 point: Dido, Elissa, the queen of Carthage. Not required to be identified by name. Supplex is acceptable, but only if the word is translated.

  2. 2 points: 1 point per action. Both the Latin words/phrase and a translation are required for each action. The identification may be contained in the translation. Minimal Latin bolded.

    Three possible answers:

    • Ire iterum in lacrimas (to go again into tears, to weep)

    • iterum temptare precando (to try again by entreating)

    • supplex animos summittere amori (as a suppliant to submit her pride to love)
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

    Three possible answers:

    • Ire iterum in lacrimas (to go again into tears, to weep)

    • iterum temptare precando (to try again by entreating)

    • supplex animos summittere amori (as a suppliant to submit her pride to love)

Student response earns one of the available points.
